title: (x) "She's got thirty days and thirty thousand miles to find a husband" sans - Gadget {Mike Y}
content:
Note the serif on the S and the tapered top of the Y. Does anyone know the name of this one?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055458im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/SHE_4815.gif)

 [‹ (x) Shepherd of the Valley Lutheran Church logo - Bodega Sans, Arial {Kate McDonnell, Marten F}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055458/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40481 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Gospel of John" Biblical face - Carolus Roman {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055458/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40459 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tonie Blaze

comments.content:
This is one of the Mac System fonts. I think it’s called Gadget.

- Mike Yanega

Yes, [Gadget](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/gadget/) is the name.

- Mike Yanega
Wow...no wonder I couldn’t find it. Thanks!
It truly is a horrendous font, although without lowercase it’s not as dramatic. :^/
I have three Macs and this font isn’t on any of them, so is it really a System font?

Hi Simon,  
<cite> is it really a System font?</cite>  
yes, but that’s _long_ ago, it <cite>showed up in System 8.5</cite>, according to [this article on Macintosh System Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055458/http:/lowendmac.com/backnforth/2k0601.html) at Lowendmac.com.

Seems it [has been made](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/gadget/gadget/mac-ttf/7111/) by [Font Bureau](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055458/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Font%252BBureau), then.  
F

I guess I should have made it balder, and more condensed, but there was a specification to follow.;)

Cheers!

Nah, not “Ouch”. “Touché” is more like it. ;^)

Yeah, I know — that’s the problem with speaking your mind on Typophile regarding your likes and dislikes of certain type designs. You’re bound to run into the designers sooner or later and sometimes it’s a totally unexpected person. :^P

But David knows I like (almost) all of his other designs, and he’s always been a good sport in our previous “run-ins”. I remember a hilarious response to a remark I made about how poorly Escrow was used in [the new De Standaard](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202055458/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=179).
